name: Snowden leaks
description: Date of the first media reporting based on leaked information.

name: COVID-19 pandemic
description: Date that it was declared a pandemic by WHO.

name: Facebook–Cambridge Analytica data scandal
description: Date the Facebook-Cambridge Analytica scandal was disclosed. Facebook stock fell by about 24%.

name: Yahoo Data Breach
description: Yahoo announced that the account information of at least 500 million users was stolen by hackers two years prior.

name: Republican National Committee (Deep Root Analytics)
description: Nearly 200 Million U.S. Voters’ Personal Data Accidentally Leaked by Data Firm Contracted by RNC.

name: Equifax Data Breach
description: Equifax announced the data breach in September 2017 eventually reporting that 147 million consumers were affected (about 56% of Americans).

name: Mark Zuckerberg's testimony to Congress
description: Zuckerberg answered questions from the Senate commerce and judiciary committees on privacy and regulations and Cambridge Analytica.

name: General Data Protection Regulation
description: Adoption of GDPR by the European Parliament; regulation went into force a month later.

name: California Consumer Privacy Act
description: The CCPA was passed by the state legislature and signed by Gov. Brown on June 28 2018; it became effective on January 1 2020.

name: EU Right to be Forgotten
description: The EU Right to be Forgotten
column5: drafted in 2012 and offiically established in May 2014
column6: is an EU bill that allows any private citizen to request there online information be removed.
